articles.description: MELEKHOVO, Russia (AP) — A Russian court convicted imprisoned opposition leader Alexei Navalny on charges of extremism and sentenced him to 19 years in prison on Friday. Navalny is already serving a nine-year term on a variety of charges that he says were politically motivated.
articles.title: Kremlin critic Navalny convicted of extremism and sentenced to 19 years in prison

articles.author: JULIE CARR SMYTH and SAMANTHA HENDRICKSON
articles.description: COLUMBUS, Ohio (AP) — Ohio voters on Tuesday resoundingly rejected a Republican-backed measure that would have made it more difficult to change the state’s constitution, setting up a fall campaign that will become the nation’s latest referendum on abortion rights since the U.S.
articles.title: Voters in Ohio reject GOP-backed proposal that would have made it tougher to protect abortion rights

articles.author: MICHELLE L. PRICE and HOLLY RAMER
articles.description: WINDHAM, N.H. (AP) — Former President Donald Trump on Tuesday kept up his attacks on special counsel Jack Smith and vowed to continue talking about his criminal cases even as prosecutors sought a protective order to limit the evidence that Trump and his team could share.
articles.title: Trump vows to keep talking about criminal cases despite prosecutors pushing for protective order

articles.author: KIM TONG-HYUNG
articles.description: SEOUL, South Korea (AP) — Dozens of flights and ferry services were grounded in South Korea on Wednesday ahead of a tropical storm that has dumped rain on Japan's southwestern islands for more than a week.
articles.title: Flights and ferries halted in South Korea ahead of storm that's dumped rain on Japan for a week

articles.author: MARK SHERMAN
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — The Supreme Court is reinstating a regulation aimed at reining in the proliferation of ghost guns, firearms without serial numbers that have been turning up at crime scenes across the nation in increasing numbers.
articles.title: Supreme Court reinstates regulation of ghost guns, firearms without serial numbers

articles.author: STEVE LeBLANC
articles.description: BOSTON (AP) — Massachusetts Gov. Maura Healey declared a state of emergency Tuesday, citing an influx of migrants seeking shelter at a time when the cost of housing — already in short supply — continues to rise.
articles.title: Massachusetts governor declares state of emergency amid influx of migrants seeking shelter

articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.description: The numbers were drawn Tuesday night for an estimated $1.58 billion Mega Millions jackpot that is the third-largest in U.S.
articles.title: Numbers drawn for giant $1.58 billion Mega Millions jackpot

articles.author: EMILY WAGSTER PETTUS
articles.description: JACKSON, Miss. (AP) — Mississippi Gov. Tate Reeves on Tuesday won the Republican nomination as he seeks a second term, setting up a general election contest against Democrat Brandon Presley in the heavily conservative state.
articles.title: Mississippi GOP Gov. Tate Reeves will face Democrat Brandon Presley in the November election

articles.author: ANDREW DALTON
articles.description: LOS ANGELES (AP) — A judge sentenced rapper Tory Lanez to 10 years in prison Tuesday for shooting and wounding hip-hop superstar Megan Thee Stallion in the feet, bringing a conclusion to a three-year legal and cultural saga that saw two careers, and lives, thrown into turmoil.
articles.title: Tory Lanez gets 10 years in prison for shooting Megan Thee Stallion

articles.author: BECKY BOHRER
articles.description: JUNEAU, Alaska (AP) — People in Alaska's capital have lived for more than a decade with periodic glacial dam outbursts like the one that destroyed at least two homes over the weekend.
articles.title: After a glacial dam outburst destroyed homes in Alaska, a look at the risks of melting ice masses
